title: Nevada man 'kidnapped, beat, burned, choked his girlfriend - forcing her to eat lye - for 16 DAYS'
text:
Authorities say Benjamin Obadiah Foster, 33, forced his girlfriend to eat lye while holding her captive in her Las Vegas apartment for 16 days before she escaped

Two weeks of captivity and brutal torture came to an end last week after a Las Vegas woman's daring escape from the clutches of her seemingly-deranged boyfriend who authorities said believed he was being watched by cameras in her apartment.

Benjamin Obadiah Foster, 33, was charged with a laundry list of felonies after his girlfriend contacted police on October 2, including kidnapping, domestic violence by strangulation and two counts of assault.

Las Vegas Metropolitan Police indicated Foster was ' trained in mixed martial arts' in an incident report.

His female victim, whose name was redacted from court records, received a shaved head, seven broken ribs, two black eyes, and chemical burns from lye, which Foster also allegedly forced her to eat, over the course of 16 days.

Foster was arraigned on charges including kidnapping, domestic violence by strangulation and two counts of assault at Clark County District Court (pictured) in Las Vegas on Thursday

Foster bound her wrists with zip ties and duct tape and choked unconscious during the ordeal, police said. At times, he also threatened to kill her while brandishing a knife and handgun, reports indicate.

The two were in a two-year relationship prior to the incident.

The violence began after Foster became paranoid his girlfriend was having him followed, according to investigators.

'Foster also told her that she had cameras hiding all inside the residence that watch him to include the microwave. 'Foster then became very physical with her,' read the text of a police report obtained by the Las Vegas Review Journal.

It appears Foster's alleged violent rampage could have been avoided.

In 2018, the 33-year-old was let out of jail on a suspended sentence for carrying a concealed weapon without a permit.

He was also awaiting trial for a separate domestic violence via strangulation charge involving another woman that took place in 2018, court records show.
description: Authorities say Benjamin Obadiah Foster, 33, forced his girlfriend to eat lye while holding her captive in her own Las Vegas apartment for 16 days before she escaped on October 2
